definition: to set oneself against/to oppose/to make a pair
worker/workshop/(slang) troublesome/high-maintenance (person)
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works
right/correct/couple/pair/towards/at/for/to face/opposite/to treat (sb a certain way)/to match together/to adjust/to fit/to suit/to answer/to reply/classifier: couple
see 成雙成對|成双成对[cheng2 shuang1 cheng2 dui4]

sentences.english: Increasingly, however, it is the Chinese who play Africans off against each other.
sentences.chinese: 然而，是中国人越来越多地操纵非洲人之间相互作对。

sentences.english: Drunk glance, setting himself against the others dual.
I suppose the scanner hates me.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得这台扫描仪老跟我作对。

sentences.english: That perverse guy has been nagging at me all day.
sentences.chinese: 那个故意与我作对的家伙让我终日不得安宁。

sentences.english: But Lott seems to be the only person talking about making a case against Phelps.
sentences.chinese: 洛特似乎是唯一一个就此事与菲尔普斯作对的人。

sentences.english: However the sandstorm is showing the opposite picture, and nobody could stop it.
sentences.chinese: 但是沙尘暴偏要来作对，那是谁也拦不住的。

sentences.english: And it would be foolish to bet against the People's Bank.
sentences.chinese: 而和人民银行作对就是犯傻。

sentences.english: Nader called Washington "corporate occupied territory" that turns the government against the interests of the people.
sentences.chinese: 纳德称美国政府“被企业占领”，与人民的利益作对。

sentences.english: What do the bad guys have against the Windy City?
sentences.chinese: 这些坏小子为什么来和风之城作对呢？

sentences.english: Do not antagonize that woman,she is dangerous.
sentences.chinese: 别与那个女人作对，她很危险。

sentences.english: He was spirited up against his boss.
sentences.chinese: 他被鼓动得与他的老板作对。

sentences.english: I know how he is. If you're not with him, you're against him.
sentences.chinese: 我了解他是什么样的人，你和他若不并肩，就是作对。

sentences.english: About his recent artworks, its more proficient and clear of his using materials.
sentences.chinese: 他的近作对材料的使用更加娴熟也更加透彻。

sentences.english: I said, ‘No, all the judiciary is already against us.
sentences.chinese: 我说，‘不，所有司法人员已经在与我们作对。

sentences.english: Soapy did likewise, with a presentiment that luck would again run against him.
sentences.chinese: 他有一种预感，命运会再一次同他作对。

definition: to adopt confrontational posture/to meet head-on/to compete
to put on a rival show (idiom); to set oneself up against sb/to get into confrontation
to express a different view/to take a different position
the two cannot exist together (idiom); irreconcilable differences/incompatible standpoints
to wallow in the mire with sb (idiom); to follow the bad example of others
to collude with/to collaborate with/to gang up with
to start a feud/to become enemies
the two cannot exist together (idiom); irreconcilable differences/incompatible standpoints
to make life difficult for/to embarrass/unable to make it through
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
to kill to the last one (idiom)/to exterminate/to eradicate/ruthless
to offend sb/to give offense/to displease
to become enemies/to become hostile towards
correct/normal/to be on good terms with/on the right track/right
(longstanding) opponent/enemy/inimical/adversary/opponent
villains collude together (idiom); to work hand in glove with sb (to nefarious ends)
see 冒大不韙|冒大不韪[mao4 da4 bu4 wei3]
pinyin: mao4 tian1 xia4 zhi1 da4 bu4 wei3
